library.name: Audio
library.description: Provides audio functionality for games using the Game library. All sound resources must be OGG files.

class.name: MusicNotFoundException
class.description: An exception thrown when the music being attempted to load is not found.

class.name: Music
class.description: Encapsulates a sound file for the purpose of playing music. Supports looping and fading transitions, but only supports one sound playback at a time.

arg.name: path
arg.description: path to a bundled OGG resource

function.name: fadeOutAndIn

arg.name: loop
arg.description: True if this music should loop indefinitely.

arg.name: outTransition
arg.description: Number of seconds to fade the current music out

arg.name: inTransition
arg.description: Number of seconds to fade this music in

function.description: Fades out the currently playing music (if any) and fades in this music.

function.name: fadeOutAndPlay

arg.name: loop
arg.description: True if this music should loop indefinitely.

arg.name: outTransition
arg.description: Number of seconds to fade the current music out

function.description: Fades out the currently playing music (if any) and starts playing this music.

function.name: play

arg.name: loop
arg.description: True if this music should loop indefinitely.

function.description: Stops the currently playing music (if any) and starts playing this music.

function.name: fadeOut

arg.name: outTransition
arg.description: Number of seconds to fade out

function.name: fadeOutCurrent

arg.name: outTransition
arg.description: Number of seconds to fade the current music out

function.description: Fades out the current music, if any.

function.name: stop
function.description: Stops the current music, if any.

function.name: fadeIn

arg.name: loop
arg.description: True if this music should loop indefinitely.

arg.name: inTransition
arg.description: Number of seconds to fade this music in

function.description: Stops the currently playing music (if any) and fades in this music.

class.name: Sound
class.description: Represents a sound that is currently active. Sound instances are created from the SoundResource.play() method.

function.name: getState

returns.description: Current state of the sound playback.

function.description: Gets the current state of the sound playback.

function.name: resume
function.description: Resumes a sound that has been paused.

function.name: stop
function.description: Stops a sound that is playing. It cannot be resumed. If you want to resume playback, use pause() instead.

function.name: getResource
function.description: Gets a reference to the original SoundResource object of this Sound.

function.name: setPan

arg.name: value
arg.description: The pan value as a ratio from -1.0 to 1.0. 0.0 represents a centered sound, while -1 will play exclusively from the left speak and 1 will play from the right speaker.

function.description: Sets the pan value for this sound. Pan is not always supported by the platform, in which case this function will do nothing.

function.name: getPan
function.description: Gets the pan value for this sound. Pan is a value from -1.0 to 1.0 that represents which speaker this sound should come out of. -1.0 is the left speaker, 1.0 is the right speaker, and 0.0 is centered. Pan is not supported on all platforms, but this value is still persisted and returned after setting it with setPan or play.

function.name: setVolume
function.description: Sets the volume of the currently playing sound. See also Audio.SoundResource.setDefaultVolume.

function.name: getVolume

returns.description: The current volume of the sound as a ratio from 0.0 to 1.0

function.description: Gets the the current volume of the playing sound.

class.name: SoundResource
class.description: Represents a file that can be played as a sound effect.

function.name: setDefaultVolume
function.description: Sets the default volume ratio for Audio.Sound objects that are played from this resource.

function.name: getDefaultVolume
function.description: Gets the default volume ratio for Audio.Sound objects that are played from this resource.

function.name: loadFromFile

arg.name: path
arg.description: Absolute or relative path to a sound file on the local disk.

function.description: Creates a new Audio.SoundResource instance for the given file.

function.name: loadFromResource
function.description: Creates a new Audio.SoundResource instance for the given bundled resource.

function.name: play

arg.name: pan
arg.description: Default pan value for playing this sound.

returns.description: A reference to the Sound scoped to this playback instance that can be used to pause, change volume, change pan, etc.

function.description: Plays this SoundResource. Returns a handle to a Audio.Sound instance which represents the current playback session. This handle can be used to pause the sound or change attributes of the playback such as volume and pan. Ignoring this handle is okay as well, if you want the sound to play normally without changing attributes or pausing it. You can optionally also pass in a default pan value to control which speakers this sound plays from (rather than adjusting it while it's playing).
